Pupphaka，（nt．） [fr．puppha2] blood J．III，541 （v．l．pubbaka； C．=lohita）； Miln．216 （tiṇa°-roga，a disease，Kern．“hay-fever”）．Kern，Toev．s．v．trsls the J passage with “vuil，uitwerpsel．” （Page 467）

Pupphaka：1．Pupphaka．The palace of Sutasoma．J．v．187．

2．Pupphaka．A parrot，discovered in a bed of flowers，hence his name．He was the Bodhisatta．For his story see Sattigumba Jātaka．J．iv．431 ff．
